text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
BURSA
- Commodity exchange in Black Sea port of Constanta to open new office in Israel.
LIBERTATEA
- Big trade unions plan nationwide protest rallies on Thursday to protest against government's plans for 5.0 percent wage indexation.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Agriculture Ministry appeals to commercial banks to give financial support to animal farms.
AZI
- Romania's foreign debt amounts to $6.0 billion.
ADEVARUL
- Despite promises, the government seems unable to recover old credits extended to African countries, the paper says.
General:
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- Most of the whiskey sold in Romania is smuggled in.
- Haul of 4.5 tonnes of hashish captured at Episcopia Bihor rail station near the Hungarian border came from Russia.
- Miron Cosma, leader of vigilante Jiu Valley coalminers, has registered his bid for a seat in the upper Senate house in the November 3 polls.
- Journalists will quizz Gyorgy Frunda, contender for the Hungarian Democratic Union (UDMR) in November 3 presidential race in commercial television Antena 1 talk show on Wednesday.
- Parliament commission is discussing ban by CNA broadcast media regulator which prevents cable operators, reaching one million subscribers, from programming electoral shows.

- Emil Constantinescu, presidential candidate for opposition Democratic Convention (CDR) bloc, visited Bucharest's RATB utility plant on electioneering trail, telling workers that neither he nor CDR is pro-monarchy.
- CDR will sign accord with former Prime Minister Petre Roman's USD alliance and with ANL Liberal alliance on monitoring fairness of November 3 elections.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Parliament mediation commission on Tuesday adopted text voted by upper Senate on homosexuality, which only provides jail sentences if homosexual relations cause "public scandal."
- Star gymnast Nadia Comaneci has been named honorary president of the Romanian Gymnastics Federation at ceremony marking 90 years since its creation.
- World Health Organisation warning about meningitis epidemic in Romania scared off fans of Germany's Borussia Dortmund due to meet Steaua Bucharest on Wednesday.
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Civil Alliance political group has lodged appeal against ruling by constitutional court on President Ion Iliescu's right to run for a new term in office.
- CDR's presidential candidate Emil Constantinescu has urged his supporters to go on missionary campaign to villages.
- Romanian institute of labour and social welfare issued first study on post-communist sexual harassment.
ADEVARUL
- Newspaper prints list of candidates selected by ruling Party of Social Democracy (PDSR) for the Novmeber 3 parliamentary polls.
- Nicu Ceausescu, youngest son of Romania's late Stalinist dictator, to be flown back home from Vienna hospital soon after second surgical operation due on Friday.
- Traian Chebeleu, President Ion Iliescu's spokesman, to be appointed ambassador to Britain.
LIBERTATEA
- Romania is only eastern European country operating soccer bookmaking offices.
ZIUA
- "Romania never sent one single Jew to (Nazi) death camps," professor Alfred Harlaoanu says in interview.
- Virgil Magureanu, head of the Romanian Intelligence service (SRI) to appear today before parliament commission in probe over alleged illegal phone tapping.
JURNALUL NATIONAL

- BNS labour unions expect 10,000 workers to attend Thursday's protest rallies in Bucharest and 13 towns across Romania over demands of 10 percent wage indexations, double the government's offer. -- Bucharest newsroom 40-1 3120264
